intro: Carolinella obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate carolinella, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hairy seeds.
